docs.text:

## Final Prompt

```linenumbs="0"
Generate an outline of a two hour course on prompt engineering.
Assume the audience is business professionals. 
List the key concepts and the order they should be presented.

Response Format:
Return the results in a single raw markdown file that can easily be copied.
Have each part of the class use the header "#### Part N: Title (duration in minutes)"
Have each subpart use an unnumbered list.

docs.title: Course Outline: Prompt Engineering for Business Professionals
Introduction (5 minutes)
docs.text:
• Definition: What is prompt engineering?
  • Relevance: Importance of prompts in modern AI and business applications.

docs.title: Part 1: Basics of Prompt Design (10 minutes)
docs.text:
1. Purpose of Prompts:
    • Elicit specific information
    • Drive desired actions
    • Guide AI models
  2. Types of Prompts:
    • Open-ended vs. Closed-ended
    • Leading vs. Neutral
    • Informational vs. Actionable

docs.title: Part 2: Prompt Engineering for AI Models (15 minutes)
docs.text:
1. Principles:
    • Clarity: Avoiding ambiguity
    • Brevity: Keeping it concise
    • Objectivity: Avoiding leading questions
  2. Optimization:
    • Iterative testing
    • Fine-tuning based on feedback
  3. Case Study: Effective prompt engineering in an AI-driven customer service chatbot.

docs.title: Part 3: Business Applications of Prompt Engineering (15 minutes)
docs.text:
1. Customer Engagement:
    • Enhancing surveys and feedback forms
    • Interactive marketing campaigns
  2. Employee Engagement:
    • Tailored training modules
    • Feedback solicitation
  3. Decision Making:
    • Guiding focus groups and brainstorming sessions
    • Elevating quality of business intelligence

docs.title: Part 4: Common Mistakes and Pitfalls (5 minutes)
docs.text:
- **Overcomplication:** Avoiding unnecessary complexity
- **Assumption:** Not presuming knowledge or intent
  1. Neglecting Diversity: Importance of considering cultural and linguistic nuances

docs.title: Part 5: Hands-on Activity: Crafting Effective Prompts (5 minutes)
docs.text:
1. Participants will be given a generic prompt. 2, They will refine and improve the prompt based on the principles discussed.
  2. Discuss and compare different participants' prompts.

docs.title: Part 6: Advanced Techniques in Prompt Engineering (2 minutes)
docs.text:
1. Prompt chaining: Using one prompt's output as the input for another.
  2. Feedback loops: Continuously improving prompts with iterative feedback.

docs.title: Part 7:  Integrating AI and Prompt Engineering in Business Strategy (2 minutes)
docs.text:
1. Enhancing decision-making processes.
  2. Streamlining operations and automating repetitive tasks.
  3. Enhancing customer experience.

docs.title: Part 8: Conclusion & Q/A Session (1 minute)
docs.text: Recap of the key concepts covered. Open the floor for questions and discussion. After this course, business professionals should have a solid understanding of prompt engineering, its relevance in the modern business environment, and practical skills to harness the power of advanced language models in their operations.
